newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Akai makes offer for remainder of Kong Wah.
newsitem.headline: Akai makes offer for remainder of Kong Wah.

text.p: Akai Electric Co Ltd said on Tuesday it would make a cash offer of HK$1.16 per share for the 3.3 percent of Kong Wah Holdings Ltd shares still in public hands.
Akai raised its stake in the television set maker to 96.7 percent as of August 29 on completion of a HK$1.16 per share offer that brought it 19.4 percent of the shares.
It said the final dividend of HK$0.04 per share for the year ended March 31, 1995, accounted for the difference between last year's general offer price of HK$1.20 per share and the latest offer.
It said it would apply to delist Kong Wah, which has been suspended from trading in Hong Kong since last October.
Akai is controlled by Semi-Tech (Global) Co Ltd.
